title: Knueppel sets rookie 3-pt. record -- in 59 games
content: Kon Knueppel broke Keegan Murray's NBA rookie record for 3-pointers, making his 207th on Thursday night against the Pacers.

title: Sources: Trump, college leaders to meet March 6
content: Conference commissioners are expected to join sports celebrities and dignitaries on March 6 in a roundtable discussion with President Donald Trump about the future of college athletics, sources said.

title: Source: Bills re-signing special teamer Franklin
content: The Buffalo Bills are re-signing special teams player and safety Sam Franklin Jr. to a three-year deal, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler.

title: OSU's Styles wows with 43.5-inch combine vertical
content: Projected top-10 pick Sonny Styles posted the best vertical jump by an off-ball linebacker at the combine since 2003 and also dazzled with a 4.46 time in the 40-yard dash and an 11-foot-2-inch broad jump Thursday.

title: Hawks plan Magic City night to honor 'institution'
content: The Hawks are paying tribute to Magic City, Atlanta's famed strip club, with a promotional night planned for March 16.

title: Neymar shushes critics after first goals in return
content: Neymar broke his 2026 goal drought in spectacular fashion Thursday, leading Santos to a 2-1 victory over Vasco da Gama in the fourth round of the Brasileirão.

title: NCAA panel proposes targeting ejection changes
content: A Division I football panel is proposing a series of rules changes involving targeting ejections, player dress codes and fair catches, the NCAA announced Thursday.

title: Source: Fins 1st, Steelers worst in NFLPA survey
content: For the third consecutive year, the Dolphins ranked first in the NFL Players Association annual report cards, according to survey results obtained by ESPN. The Steelers finished last.

title: ⌚ Panarin gifts mascot a Rolex for jersey number
content: Panarin wanted to wear the No. 72 upon being traded to Los Angeles. The only problem is the Kings' mascot already wore that number.

title: Let's match NFL free agents to all 32 teams: Ideal landing spots for the biggest names
content: Mike Evans to the Bills? Malik Willis to the Jets? Riq Woolen to the Jaguars? We found free agent fits for all 32 NFL teams this offseason.

title: Best NFL combine workouts, draft risers: The top performances and prospects from Day 1
content: Top prospects such as David Bailey and Ohio State's linebacker duo starred. Here are our experts on the combine's top workouts.

title: Preview: Who will book their tickets to WrestleMania 42?
content: Out of the WWE loop? Here's everything you need to know ahead of Saturday's Elimination Chamber in Chicago.

title: Why the East race is full of high stakes: 'Not a lot of honeymoons going on'
content: Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst survey the league to see who has the edge in the wide-open Eastern Conference.

title: Isaiah Stewart, Ben Wallace and the legacy of Detroit's enforcer
content: The intimidation, the electric blocks -- and the suspensions -- are all part of the Beef Stew experience.

title: 'You're looking at a Ferrari': Introducing Konnor Griffin, MLB's next teenage superstar
content: The No. 1 prospect in baseball has a chance to join exclusive company on Opening Day -- if the Pirates are willing to let him.

title: Trade tier rankings: Which big names could bring a Stanley Cup?
content: The playoff races have restarted, with many teams seeking to bolster their rosters for a deep run this spring.

title: Cleveland Heights to honor Olympic gold medalist Laila Edwards
content: Cleveland Heights plans to honor Edwards, the first Black woman to play for the U.S. women's national team.

title: Men's Power Rankings: Can any team catch Duke?
content: The Blue Devils look like they have the inside track to the top overall seed in the men's NCAA tournament.

title: Latest Bracketology: How two upsets turned the ACC into a nine-bid league
content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: Premier League Power Rankings: Chelsea up, Liverpool down in ratings of all 20 teams
content: ESPN's Premier League Power Rankings return to look at all 20 teams: Chelsea are up, Liverpool are down, and Crystal Palace are on fire.

title: Do the USWNT's up-and-comers really have a shot at the Women's World Cup roster?
content: The USWNT's roster for the SheBelieves Cup had eight players with six caps or less. Are these youngsters competing for World Cup spots?

title: What to expect at NFL combine workouts: Kiper, Miller, Reid and Yates answer 11 questions
content: Which NFL draft prospects should have great combine performances? Who could run the fastest 40-yard dashes, and who will climb boards this week?

title: Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao are fighting: Is this 2011?
content: Securing this rematch more than a decade after their first meeting feels like a sequel to a poorly received movie.

title: Women's boxing pound-for-pound rankings: A unanimous choice for No. 1
content: Claressa Shields' continued dominance keeps her firmly atop the list. Here's the latest pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Stashing these injured players is a winning move
content: Eric Karabell serves up a list of currently injured players to keep on your radar for the last few rounds of your fantasy drafts.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Randle finishes in top 10, Nembhard in top 50
content: Eric Karabell forecasts what to expect from notable players such as Julius Randle, LaMelo Ball and more.

title: Champions League round of 16 predictions: Real Madrid over Man City?
content: The path to the Champions League final is now mapped out, but who do we think makes it all the way to Budapest? Mark Ogden makes his picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Chelsea, PSG watch Genk trio
content: Scouts from clubs including Chelsea, Manchester City, Man United and Paris Saint-Germain watched three Racing Genk stars play. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: 'Did Robert Vadra, Rahul Gandhi go to jail?' Kejriwal hits back as Congress questions HC relief
content: In a strongly worded ruling, Special Judge (PC Act) Jitender Singh of the Rouse Avenue Court said the prosecution’s case was "legally infirm, unsustainable, and unfit to proceed any further in law". The court further observed that when the material collected by the agency was tested on admissibility, relevance and probative value, "the appearance of a coherent conspiracy dissolves," exposing the allegations as being founded on inadmissible material and post-facto reconstruction.

title: Full text of Delhi court order: Kejriwal and Sisodia discharged in excise policy case
content: A Delhi court discharged former Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia in the excise policy case, citing insufficient evidence. The court found no criminal intent or conspiracy substantiated by the chargesheet and supporting documents.  The prosecution failed to establish a larger criminal conspiracy, leading to the discharge of 23 individuals.

title: Sourav Ganguly's message to India selectors: Take Auqib Nabi to England
content: Sourav Ganguly has backed Jammu and Kashmir pacer Auqib Nabi for national selection following his stellar Ranji Trophy final performance. Nabi's five-wicket haul and league-leading 60 wickets this season have earned him praise, with Ganguly suggesting a call-up for the 2026 England white-ball tour.

title: Anthropic CEO tells Nikhil Kamath why he could not work in OpenAI
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei revealed that differing visions on AI development and scaling were the primary reasons for his departure from OpenAI. He emphasized the significant performance gains observed through larger models and more data, a concept he termed "scaling laws.

title: Kerala high court stay lifted: Bench allows 'The Kerala Story 2' release
content: The Kerala High Court has lifted a temporary ban on the film 'The Kerala Story 2'. A Division Bench stayed an earlier order that had stalled the movie's release for 15 days. The court had previously asked the CBFC to re-watch and reassess the film's certification due to allegations of promoting hatred.

title: Block lays off 40% staff after CEO Jack Dorsey calls layoffs 'destructive to morale'
content: Block, led by CEO Jack Dorsey, has drastically cut its workforce by nearly half, impacting over 4,000 employees. Dorsey cited a shift towards leaner, AI-driven operations as the reason, preferring a single, decisive layoff to avoid prolonged uncertainty and morale damage. Generous severance packages are being offered to departing staff.

title: Labour Pain: Why Green win is UK bypolls is a major red flag of Keir Starmer
content: The numbers alone capture the scale of Labour’s collapse. The Greens secured 14,980 votes, representing 40.7 percent of the electorate. Reform UK came second with 10,578 votes, or 28.7 percent. Labour was pushed into third place with just 9,364 votes, amounting to 25.4 percent. The Conservatives, once Labour’s primary rival, were reduced to a marginal presence with only 1,721 votes, or 4.7 percent. Turnout stood at 47.6 percent, indicating a serious electoral contest rather than a fringe protest. What had been a Labour majority exceeding 13,000 votes at the last general election was erased within a single parliamentary term.

title: Shirtless protest case: Delhi court grants interim bail to Congress youth wing worker
content: A Delhi court granted interim bail until March 24 to Indian Youth Congress general secretary Nigam Bhandhari in connection with the AI event protest. Bhandhari, who sought anticipatory bail, must cooperate with the ongoing investigation. The protest involved IYC workers revealing T-shirts with anti-PM slogans during the AI Summit. According to police, the protest was planned with a “common intention".

title: Meta may have signed Google deal whose news wiped $250 bn from Nvidia’s market value
content: Meta is reportedly boosting its artificial intelligence investments. The company is said to be partnering with Google for AI chips. This multi-billion dollar deal aims to build Meta's next generation of AI models. The social media giant also recently announced a tie-up with AMD. Meta is also in talks to buy Google's specialized chips outright.

title: Dropped catches hurt India as Aus win 2nd ODI, take 6-4 lead in all-format series
content: Australia Women secured a commanding five-wicket victory over India Women, clinching the ODI series 2-0. Georgia Voll's century and Phoebe Litchfield's brisk 80 laid the foundation for the successful chase after India posted 251/9. This win extends Australia's all-format series lead, leaving India with much to ponder.

title: Excise case: CBI moves Delhi HC to challenge lower court order discharging Kejriwal
content: The case originated from allegations surrounding the now-withdrawn Delhi Excise Policy 2021-22 introduced by the Aam Aadmi Party government. The CBI had alleged that the policy framework was tailored to benefit certain private players through reduced licence fees and predetermined profit margins, resulting in kickbacks and financial losses to the Delhi government.

title: New GDP series: When will India become the fourth largest economy? CEA explains
content: Chief Economic Advisor V. Anantha Nageswaran has expressed confidence of above 7% GDP growth potential of the economy. India is on path to become the world’s third largest economy by the end of this decade - third only to the US and China.

title: India’s GDP grows at 7.8% in Q3 FY2025-26: Top highlights from first data under new series
content: India’s economy grew at 7.8% in the October–December quarter of 2025-26, compared with 7.4% in the corresponding period a year earlier, according to the revised national accounts series.

title: 'Yuvraj is his mentor': Ashwin shushes Amir over 'slogger' remark
content: Ravichandran Ashwin defended Abhishek Sharma after Mohammad Amir called him “just a slogger” following three ducks in the T20 World Cup. Abhishek silenced critics with a quick 55 off 30 balls against Zimbabwe. Ashwin praised his bat swing and rejected the label, while Abhishek said he had waited for this moment and appreciated the team’s support.

title: US military shoots down govt drone in Texas, leading to flight disruption
content: In a joint statement, the Pentagon, the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) and CBP confirmed that the military used a "counter-unmanned aircraft system ... to mitigate a seemingly threatening unmanned aerial system operating within military airspace." The agencies added that the episode "took place far away from populated areas and there were no commercial aircraft in the vicinity.

title: Afghanistan vs Pakistan: How the two militaries compare amid ‘open war’ declaration
content: Pakistan and Afghanistan are locked in an escalating conflict following cross-border strikes. Pakistan's defence minister declared an "open war," citing the worst escalation since October. The military disparity is stark: Pakistan boasts a significantly larger, better-equipped force with advanced air power and a nuclear arsenal, while Afghanistan's capabilities have declined, highlighting a vast imbalance in manpower, firepower, and defence spending.

title: 'May you find strength ... ': Kohli's emotional note after demise of Rinku's father
content: Rinku Singh's father breathed his last on Friday morning at the Yatharth Hospital in Greater Noida, informed the hospital PRO. He was undergoing treatment at Yatharth Hospital in Greater Noida,.

title: Watch: Strong earthquake rattles Kolkata, residents flee homes, offices in panic
content: Strong tremors, estimated at magnitude 5.4, shook Kolkata on Friday afternoon, causing panic and prompting residents to evacuate homes and offices. The earthquake's epicenter was located just 3 km inside Bangladesh, near the India-Bangladesh border, with tremors felt across the city and surrounding areas.

title: 'No overarching conspiracy or criminal intent': Why court cleared Kejriwal, Sisodia in excise case
content: Delhi excise policy case: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia, and 21 others in the excise policy case, citing a lack of cogent evidence and no prima facie case. The judge found no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent in the policy's formulation, criticising the CBI's investigative approach and reliance on approver statements.

title: Domestic help carries out 'fake ED raid' at retired employer's house
content: A domestic help orchestrated a fake Enforcement Directorate raid on her elderly employer's home in Delhi, enlisting relatives and associates. The plan unraveled when the victim's grandson, an ED lawyer, confronted the imposters by phone, leading to their escape with a portion of the stolen cash. The maid and her sister-in-law have been arrested.

title: Modi, Amit Shah hatched biggest conspiracy of independent India to crush AAP: Kejriwal
content: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal hailed his discharge in the CBI's excise policy case as a "triumph of truth," calling the investigation a politically motivated conspiracy to dismantle the AAP. He asserted his honesty and accused Prime Minister Modi and Home Minister Shah of orchestrating a "fabricated" case to jail top party leaders.

title: Stock market down: Nifty50 below 25,200, Sensex crashes over 1,000 points - top reasons
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex crashed in trade on Friday on weak global cues and persistent FII selling. While Nifty50 went below 25,200, BSE Sensex dropped over 1,000 points.

title: A chilling confession, 3 gunshots and tense standoff: UP man kills wife’s lover in Meerut
content: A man shot dead his estranged wife's partner in Meerut after a long-standing domestic dispute over child custody. The accused later appeared in a social media video admitting to the crime and threatening his wife. He was apprehended by police after a standoff in a sugarcane field.

title: Newlyweds Rashmika-Vijay make their first appearance after their wedding — watch
content: Newlyweds Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda made their first public appearance as a married couple after returning from their Udaipur wedding. Rashmika stunned in a vibrant red bridal ensemble, while Vijay complemented her in a silver kurta pyjama. The affectionate pair walked hand-in-hand, sharing warm greetings and flying kisses with the paparazzi, who showered them with congratulations.

title: T20 World Cup: What Team India needs to do to reach semi-finals
content: India's path to the T20 World Cup 2026 semi-finals is now clear, with a win against West Indies at Eden on Sunday securing their spot. Following South Africa's victory, the final Group 1 match is a virtual quarterfinal. India's dominant batting performance against Zimbabwe set them up for this crucial encounter.

title: Howrah gang war explodes: Rivalry ends in point-blank execution
content: Howrah Police arrested three associates of Harun Khan, the main suspect in a gang war shooting that claimed Mohammad Shafiq's life. The trio, apprehended in Kolkata, allegedly aided Khan and his accomplice Rohit Hossain in their escape after the murder. Investigations reveal the killing stemmed from a territorial dispute and extortion rivalry between rival gangs.

title: ‘Cup of patience has overflowed’: Why Pakistan launched strikes on Afghanistan's major cities
content: Pakistan conducted air strikes on major Afghan cities, including Kabul, Kandahar, and Paktia, escalating border tensions. This action follows retaliatory attacks by Taliban forces, with Pakistan declaring an "open war" after cross-border clashes. The confrontation marks a significant escalation since the Taliban's return to power in 2021.

title: Watch: Teary Kejriwal's emotional moment with wife Sunita & kids
content: A Delhi court discharged Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia in the liquor excise policy case, refusing to take cognisance of the CBI chargesheet. The court found no criminal intent or substantiated conspiratorial role, stating allegations failed judicial scrutiny. Both leaders were greeted with emotional celebrations by family and supporters.

title: Ram Charan's business empire: Actor builds ventures in films, sports, aviation
content: Tollywood star Ram Charan, son of Chiranjeevi, has built an impressive empire beyond his 18-year acting career.  He leads big-budget films and runs diverse businesses, including a production house, a polo club, and investments in healthcare and startups. His ventures showcase a sharp business acumen, complementing his successful filmography and earning him a substantial net worth.

title: ‘No words feel enough’: Ex-cricketers stand with Rinku after father’s passing
content: Former cricketers are extending heartfelt condolences to Rinku Singh following the passing of his father, Khanchand Singh. Rinku, who left the T20 World Cup to be with his family, is receiving support from figures like Harbhajan Singh, Yuvraj Singh, and Virender Sehwag. IPL franchises have also shared their sympathies during this difficult period.

title: Forest department turns to fishermen to rescue Dugongs trapped in fishing gear
content: Nine Dugongs were rescued near Pudukottai coast in the last one year; Forest department has been using a drone to monitor Dugongs besides carrying out daily boat patrolling

title: Institutions under Cooperation Department draw criticism for impeding CAG audit
content: CAG notes that all through the course of SSCA,  audit encountered persistent non-production of essential records/critical information by the audited institutions at all levels

title: Never claimed I was ill while resigning, says former V-P Jagdeep Dhankhar
content: The former V-P stressed that he was only “giving priority” to his health when he quit in the middle of his term on July 21, 2025; he spoke while on a “personal visit” to a Congress MP’s home in Rajasthan

title: Ambedkar dedicated himself to the quest for justice, says scholar
content: He was of the view that discrimination within the caste system is not accidental but constructed, says Rajeev Bhargava of Parekh Institute of Indian Thought

title: TDP complains to CID against ‘defamatory’ social media post on Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The party accuses the YSR Congress Party of orchestrating a malicious campaign to tarnish the Chief Minister’s image, and seeks strict action against those responsible

title: Nandi awards and ‘natakotsavams’ should reflect cultural richness of State, says Andhra Pradesh Tourism Minister Kandula Durgesh
content: Emphasising the need to align the State’s cultural initiatives with the government’s vision to strengthen the creative economy, he says a new film policy will be introduced to encourage  shootings in the State

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Karnataka DGP issues Statewide Holi bandobast guidelines, focus on women’s safety and communal harmony
content: The directive said all police units have been instructed to implement preventive, intelligence-based and gender-sensitive policing measures to ensure peaceful celebrations.

title: II PUC annual exam-1 begins on February 28
content: To curb malpractices, the Karnataka State Examination and Assessment Board will be web-streaming all the examination processes

title: Bengaluru police book unknown man for filming woman using restroom at restaurant
content: An investigator in the case said that the accused fled the scene as soon as she seized the phone, and a manhunt has been launched to trace him.

title: Telangana pays highest salaries to govt employees; junior lineman’s ₹52,000 entry level salary increases to ₹1.91 lakh after 2 decades
content: Telangana’s expenditure on salaries and pensions is 21.09% of revenue expenditure in 2025-26, 40% when coupled with interest payment. This is likely to rise further.

title: Meghalaya issues health advisory after meningococcal infection scare
content: The State’s Health and Family Welfare Department has advised precautionary measures after the death of two Agniveer trainees in Shillong

title: Kerala Govt. files appeal before High Court against acquittal of Dileep, others in actor rape case
content: In its plea, the Government further contended that the trial court did not consider many digital evidences pertaining to the case

title: CBI challenges in HC trial court order discharging Arvind Kejriwal, others in liquor-policy case
content: "The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has decided to appeal in the high court against the judgment of the trial court immediately since several aspects of the investigation have either been ignored or not considered adequately," CBI said in a statement

title: Nine arrested in Hyderabad for fabricating vehicle insurance policies; racket active since 2020
content: Police seize 441 fake vehicle insurance certificates issued in the names of leading insurers; total premium amount reflected on the forged policies - ₹91 lakh

title: Bihar govt. to review anti-conversion laws of other States, implement its own if needed: Speaker
content: BJP legislator tells House that some States have laws with provisions for stricter punishment if a person’s life and wealth are put under threat for religious conversion

title: Supreme Court quashes FIR against former regional head of Zee Rajasthan in extortion case
content: Mr. Dave had moved the apex court against a Rajasthan High Court order that had refused to quash the FIR against him, saying, “Media professionals are expected to avoid causing undue harm to anyone by way of threat or extortion.”

title: INS Anjadip: The story behind the Navy’s latest warship name
content: INS Anjadip, nicknamed Dolphin Hunter, is named after the island off the coast of Karwar in north Karnataka, aiming to boost India’s warfare capabilites

title: Maharashtra government derecognises 107 board exam centres over malpractice
content: “Recognition for 31 and 76 exam centres for Class 10 and 12 board exams, respectively, was cancelled after instances of malpractice were reported around January 13,” says Minister

title: Watch: Can India compete with China in rare earths? | Data Point
content: India has stepped up its exploration of rare-earth minerals. The government has announced rare-earth corridors, cleared a ₹73-billion plan to build a domestic rare-earth magnet ecosystem, and expanded surveys across coastal sands and hard-rock regions. On paper, India seems ready. But having rare earths in the ground is not the same as having them in your supply chain

title: 5 months, 17 months, and finally freedom: Kejriwal, Sisodia cleared in Delhi excise case
content: Former Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia were acquitted in the Delhi excise policy case. Kejriwal spent five months in jail, while Sisodia was incarcerated for 17 months. The case, investigated by the CBI and ED, alleged irregularities in the 2021-22 liquor policy.

title: Fresh look at India-US trade deal? May be ‘rebalanced’ if circumstances change, says Goyal
content: Piyush Goyal’s comments assume significance after the US Supreme Court ruled that Donald Trump administration's reciprocal tariffs are illegal. Soon after, Trump signed an executive order to impose a 10% global tariff on America’s trading partners.

title: Haryana govt official jumps to death from 6th floor of civil secretariat in Chandigarh
content: A special secretary at the Haryana civil secretariat, Ganesh Das Arora, 58, died by suicide by jumping from his office building. A suicide note found at the scene stated no external pressure, though workplace stress is being investigated. Arora was reportedly distressed over a recent department transfer and was due to retire in October.

title: T20 WC Super 8s standings: India set for virtual QF as SA seal semis spot
content: Defending champions India face a crucial Super 8 clash against the West Indies on Sunday. A victory in Kolkata will secure their semi-final spot in the T20 World Cup. South Africa has already qualified from Group 1. Meanwhile, England have advanced from Group 2, with New Zealand and Pakistan vying for the remaining berth.

title: Watch: President Murmu take sortie in indigenous light combat helicopter 'Prachand'
content: President Droupadi Murmu experienced a flight in the indigenously built Light Combat Helicopter 'Prachand' near the Pakistan border in Jaisalmer. This advanced aircraft, designed for diverse terrains and equipped with modern weaponry, significantly enhances the Indian Air Force's capabilities. The President's sortie underscores India's growing self-reliance in defense technology.

title: ED attaches ₹90 crore assets linked to ‘strongman’ involved in coercive settlements of high-value loans
content: Wanted by three enforcement agencies, the accused is currently residing in the United Arab Emirates (UAE); the attached properties comprise various plots and land parcels, residential and commercial properties owned by Mr. Yadav and his wife Reena Kumari

title: Irregularities occurred in implementing employment guarantee scheme in Vizianagaram
content: The inquiry found misappropriation of ₹41.71 lakh from the total works worth ₹9.54 crore verified during the audit period, the Deputy Chief Minister told the Legislative Council

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan inaugurates CBG plant at Brahmapuram
content: Agreements have been signed with BPCL to set up compressed biogas - based waste treatment plants in Kozhikode and Kollam, while projects are being developed under Public-Private Partnership model in Palakkad and Thrissur, and another under the Kerala Solid Waste Management Project in Changanassery

title: New GDP series upgrades FY26 growth to 7.6%, but lowers size of India’s economy
content: According to the new data, India’s nominal GDP — which is essentially the size of the economy — has been revised downward for the three years spanning 2023-26, which will have a negative impact on several fiscal ratios

title: ‘The Kerala Story 2’: HC stays single judge order halting film release
content: High Court permitts the screening if CBFC issues a certificate stating that the alleged controversial portions in the film’s teaser and trailer do not find mention in the film

title: ‘The Rise of Ashoka’ movie review: Sathish Ninasam’s film drowns in formula
content: ‘The Rise of Ashoka’, starring Sathish Ninasam and Sapthami Gowda has a social theme, but the film is bogged down by cliched ideas and over-the-top characters

title: CII meet charts roadmap for driving next growth wave in Mysuru region
content: Nitesh Patil, Regional Commissioner, Mysuru division, observed that Mysuru is well-positioned to capitalise on its strengths in quality of life, talent and infrastructure

title: Congress stages walkout from Chhattisgarh Assembly over alleged illegal fly ash dumping in Raigarh
content: State’s Finance Minister O.P. Choudhary informed the House that from 2023 till February 4, 2026, fly ash generated by 24 thermal power plants in Raigarh district was utilised for land filling and mine filling

title: ‘Freed of Saturn’s affliction’: AIADMK welcomes Panneerselvam’s switch to DMK
content: However, describing Mr. Panneerselvam’s move as “unfortunate,” former interim general secretary of the AIADMK, V.K. Sasikala, in a post on social media, said the DMK was an “evil force” that must be removed from the State’s political scene

title: Unfortunate that ‘Keralam’ could not understand the essence of Union Budget, says Union Minister Suresh Gopi
content: Union Budget 2026-27 gave  special focus on shaping the future of the country’s youth, says Suresh Gopi

title: No decision yet on NDA’s CM candidate for Karnataka, says Leader of Opposition R. Ashok
content: He said that any decision on the CM candidate will involve the alliance’s leadership comprising Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the party’s national president

title: Canada PM Mark Carney arrives in Mumbai on four-day India visit
content: The Canadian leader will meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi on March 2; he will address the India-Canada CEO Forum before returning to Canada

title: Karnataka leadership change: D.K. Shivakumar loyalists hold dinner meeting to lobby for his promotion to CM post
content: Another round of meeting of D K Shivakumar loyalists likely to be held before the State budget session, which will start from March 6

title: What can Karnataka expect from State Budget 2026-27? | Decode Karnataka
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is set to present his 17th Budget on March 6 — a record in the state’s history.

title: Fugitive economic offender from Uttar Pradesh arrested in UAE on ED's request: Officials
content: The probe relates to a money laundering case initiated after the Enforcement Directorate took cognisance of 554 cases registered by Uttar Pradesh Police against Naseem and the Lucknow-based Shine City group of companies

title: Tickets booked for ‘The Kerala Story 2’ being refunded, film not released: lawyers for petitioners
content: Advocate for a petitioner says contempt plea will not be moved against film’s producer as the movie has not been released and ticket sales are being refunded

title: Right to hold passport, travel abroad integral facet of personal liberty: Delhi HC
content: Justice Purushaindra Kumar Kaurav passed the order while setting aside the Centre's decision to impound the passport of Yogesh Raheja, erstwhile Director of Raheja Developers, for failing to disclose the pendency of an FIR against him at the time of applying for renewal

title: Meghalaya issues health advisory after meningococcal infection scare
content: The State’s Health and Family Welfare Department has advised precautionary measures after the death of two Agniveer trainees in Shillong

title: Tourists get wifi in Yana, Sahasralinga and other remote areas in Uttara Kannada district of Karnataka
content: GNA in collaboration with BSNL and Acer India, has introduced WiFi connectivity in 10 more remote areas, Sathodi Falls and Magod waterfalls in UK district

title: Over six lakh Maharashtra farmers yet to get 2017 loan waiver scheme benefit: Minister in Assembly
content: Under the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Shetkari Sanman Yojana, 44.04 lakh farmers, out of the total 50.60 lakh eligible ones, have so far received benefits of the loan waiver scheme, while the process for the remaining 6.56 lakh farmers is underway

title: Watch: PM Modi in Israel: a missed opportunity on Palestine: The Hindu Editorial
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s 24-hour visit to Jerusalem was a significant bilateral outreach to Israel, but a missed opportunity on Palestine, with complex consequences for India’s ties with West Asia.

title: Watch: Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia cleared of charges in Delhi liquor policy case
content: A Delhi court discharged all 23 accused in the 2021–22 excise policy case, including Arvind Kejriwal, Manish Sisodia and K Kavitha, ruling there was “no overarching conspiracy or criminal intent”. The judge said the CBI’s case was based on conjecture.

title: Like many before him, Panneerselvam joins DMK, but here’s why he is different
content: None of those who went back to the DMK or began their new innings in the ruling party were seriously considered for the post of Chief Minister when they were in the AIADMK. But Mr. Panneerselvam was handpicked by Jayalalithaa in 2001 and 2014 to head the government

title: India focused on getting best trade deal with U.S., Indian Trade Minister says
content: “The South Asian ‌nation is ​focused on engaging ⁠to ensure it secures ‌the best deal in terms of competitive ‌advantage compared to peers,” ​says Piyush ‌Goyal

title: NCERT textbook row: Kerala Education Minister welcomes SC intervention, seeks probe
content: In a Facebook post, Minister V. Sivankutty welcomes apex court’s stand against references that allegedly undermined the judiciary

title: Ready for narco test to establish truth in POCSO case: Swami Avimukteshwaranand
content: Avimukteshwaranand said even if any wrongdoing had occurred, it would not automatically establish who was responsible. “The child who never came to us cannot be easily linked to our name,” he said.

title: Last rites of former soldier in Karnataka village exposes practice of untouchability
content: Officials visit village in Bagalkot district of Karnataka following complaints of shops being closed during final rites of Hanumanthappa Harijan

title: SC collegium decides to transfer judges proposed to be CJs of HCs well in advance
content: The collegium, headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant, said the decision was taken so that the judge, becomes well conversant with the affairs of that High Court and assumes charge of the office of the Chief Justice

title: Rohith Vemula Bill, honour killing Bill referred for further review: Karnataka minister
content: Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister H.K. Patil said the proposed legislations were examined in detail, and certain aspects required additional consultation with the home department.

title: Industry must invest, innovate; take advantage of Budget announcements: PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister was addressing a post-Budget webinar on ‘Technology, Reforms and Finance for Viksit Bharat’

title: Booking of tickets for ‘The Kerala Story 2’ going on despite stay: petitioners tell High Court
content: The petitioners had approached the High Court alleging that the film’s teaser and trailer portrayed Kerala in a bad light

title: Priority to Kannada in administration emphasised at 12th Dharwad Taluk Kannada Sahitya Sammelana
content: Dharwad Taluk 12th Kannada Sahitya Sammelana was held at Alur Venkatrao Bhavan in Dharwad on February 26

title: Sustainable practices adopted in space offer lessons for NE States in renewable energy: Shukla
content: He commended Meghalaya's efforts to promote clean energy in rural and remote regions where conventional electricity supply remains a challenge

title: Woman hacked to death on suspicion of practising witchcraft in Jharkhand, one held
content: The incident took place in Baghima Ambatoli village under the Palkot Police Station limits on Wednesday, 25, when the woman was attacked by two men

title: 30,514 students to appear for second PUC exams in Kalaburagi district
content: As many as 51 examination centres have been set up across the district, including 25 in urban areas and 26 in taluk regions

title: Uproar as Muslim family faces eviction pressure in Muzaffarnagar locality from anti-social elements
content: The opposition Congress hit out at the State government for emboldening anti-social elements who create communal division in U.P.

title: Questioning begins in online abuse of actress Anasuya; technical hurdles slow probe
content: Earlier, Cyberabad Police had booked 73 individuals in connection with the case, which is being investigated by a team of around a dozen officers

title: Vande Mataram to be sung every morning in Rajasthan Panchayati Raj offices: Minister
content: The Panchayati Raj Minister said that only India-made products would be used in all Ministry offices. If foreign-made items are found in use, the cost would be recovered from the concerned official

title: Three-time T.N. CM, Jayalalithaa’s trusted lieutenant O. Panneerselvam joins DMK ahead of Assembly polls
content: “The entire country is closely watching the leadership of CM M.K. Stalin. He has set the grammar for how to run a political party,” Mr. Paneerselvam told the media

title: KSU leader’s house in Kozhikode attacked with country bomb amid political tensions in Kerala
content: Bomb was allegedly hurled at house of KSU Kozhikode district secretary Bithul Balan at Thiruvallur around 2.30 a.m.

title: Former DMK MLA, six others get life imprisonment for farmer’s murder in Tiruvannamalai
content: The police said Kamalakannan was the son of former DMK MLA Jayaraman, who served as the Vandavasi MLA from 2006. After Jayaraman’s sudden death, Kamalakannan contested as a DMK candidate and won in the by-election held in 2009

title: JSS Polytechnic to offer diploma courses for physically challenged persons in Mysuru
content: JSS Polytechnic for the Differently Abled will be offering various diploma courses exclusively for physically challenged students in Mysuru

title: Ramesh Chennithala seeks Kerala CM’s resignation alleging data leak of 1 crore citizens
content: Chennithala seeks criminal proceedings against Chief Minister and all officials who were part of the alleged ‘illegal transaction’

title: Officials on Bengal SIR work enter Odisha village by 'mistake', assaulted by locals, 72 arrested
content: “The incident took place on February 26 when the two officials entered a village in Raibania police station area in Balasore district, which shares a border with West Bengal,” says police

title: 8 cheetahs from Africa to arrive at M.P.'s Kuno National Park on Saturday
content: This will be the third batch of cheetahs arriving from Africa, following earlier introductions from Namibia and South Africa

title: Arvind Kejriwal Breaks Down After Court Relief, Manish Sisodia Consoles Him
content: Arvind Kejriwal recounted that he was picked up from his home and thrown into jail. That did not break him. Nearly two years later, he broke down in tears when a court cleared him of all charges in the Delhi liquor policy case.

title: Meet Nikesh Arora, US Billionaire Hosting Daughter's Grand Wedding In Jodhpur
content: Indian-origin billionaire Nikesh Arora's daughter Ayesha is set to marry Jack Hughes in a four-day celebration in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. The wedding will be held at the Umaid Bhawan Palace on Saturday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | T20 World Cup: India's 'Aura' Is Cracked - And South Africa Can See It
content: India know full well that a new title favourite has staked their claim and once again emerged as the defending champions' biggest hurdle.

title: 6 Killed As Sleeper Bus Hits Trailer In Rajasthan: Cops
content: Six persons were killed while several others sustained injuries after a private sleeper bus crashed into a trailer in Rajasthan's Balotra district on Friday, police said.

title: China Calls For Afghanistan, Pakistan To Show Restraint, Reach Ceasefire
content: China on Friday called on Pakistan and Afghanistan to work out a ceasefire while expressing concern over the escalation of the conflict between the two countries.

title: The Challenges In Congress's Fight To Rise From 'Zero' In Bengal
content: The Congress party is preparing to regain some lost ground in West Bengal in the upcoming 2026 assembly elections.

title: Video: Stunning Mid-Air Strike As Ukrainian M134 Tracers Light Up The Night
content: A Ukrainian An-28 door gunner shot down a Russian Shahed attack drone with an M134 minigun in a dramatic mid-air strike, newly released footage shows.

title: Taliban Readies 'Suicide Squad' After Pakistan Bombs Afghan Cities
content: Pakistani forces bombed Taliban government targets in Afghanistan's major cities, with Islamabad calling the conflict an "open war."

title: 'Resist The Temptation': Pope Leo Urges Priests Not To Use AI To Write Sermons
content: Pope Leo stressed that a true homily is more than an intellectual exercise, saying it should come from personal belief and lived faith.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The Hypocrisy Of Pakistan And Turkey's Frustration With India-Israel Ties
content: Even before the conclusion of PM Modi's visit, editorials and op-eds appeared in Pakistani and Turkish media, indulging in fear-mongering about India and Israel's deepening ties.

title: 'Leave Israel Today': US Envoy's Message To Staff Amid Iran Tension
content: US Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee told embassy staff on Friday that if they want to leave Israel, they should do it "today".

title: Live Updates: "Arvind Kejriwal Was Sent To Jail For Sake Of Power," Says Wife Sunita Kejriwal
content: Delhi Excise Policy Case LIVE Updates: During the judgment, the court said it found no evidence against Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia, and that the CBI's allegations "lacked substance".

title: From Podcast To Protest: Why JNU Is Erupting Over Vice Chancellor's Comments
content: JNU is seething with rage. Barely a week after a "night of terror", the students were involved in a bitter, some would say 'biting', clash with the Delhi cops.

title: "You Want To Hang Him": Supreme Court To Nitish Katara's Family On Convict Vikas Yadav
content: The Supreme Court has granted furlough till March 7 to murder convict Vikas Yadav to attend Holi. Yadav, the son of former MP DP Yadav, has served 23 of the 25-year sentence he received for the murder of Nitish Katara in 2002.

title: "Ajit Era Will Never End": Rohit Pawar Warns Against 'Whitewash' In Crash Probe
content: In a significant political meeting lasting over an hour and fifteen minutes, NCP (SP) MLA Rohit Pawar met MNS chief Raj Thackeray to discuss the recent accident involving late deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar.

title: Kedarnath Choked By Trash, RTI Reveals 22% Surge In Waste
content: In the shadow of the snow-capped Himalayas, where millions seek spiritual solace at one of Hinduism's holiest shrines, a mounting crisis is unfolding: Kedarnath is drowning in its own garbage.

title: Economy Grew By 7.8% In October-December: New GDP Series Data
content: India's economy grew 7.8 per cent in October-December from the same period a year earlier, after posting 8.4 per cent growth in the previous quarter, the Centre said on Friday.

title: Bangladesh Invites Indian Choir For Concert As Dhaka Seeks To Reset Ties
content: As New Delhi and Dhaka look to reset ties under the new Tarique Rahman-led Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) government, Bangladesh's envoy to India has proposed a cultural bridge between the two nations.

title: Will The Fight To Succeed 'El Mencho' Spark New Wave Of Violence In Mexico?
content: The killing of Nemesio Oseguera, also known as "El Mencho," constituted a victory for the government of President Claudia Sheinbaum.

title: Strong Earthquake Tremors Felt In Kolkata, Offices Evacuated
content: People in Kolkata came running out of homes, offices and schools after the tremors of the earthquake, that struck Bangladesh, were felt in the city.

title: Prospects to watch: From the high school son of a former MLB All-Star to the next Mets ace﻿
content: the 2026 World Baseball Classic offers a unique opportunity to get a glimpse at some of baseball's stars of tomorrow . one of the most intriguing is Joseph Contreras, a prep right-hander in Georgia and the son of former big league righty . he is best known for his time with the New York Yankees and Chicago White Sox .

title: Kiper's latest NFL mock draft: Projecting the entire first round ahead of the combine
content: more than 300 prospects will be in Indianapolis this week for the combine . only 32 of them will ultimately go in Round 1 of the 2026 NFL draft on April 23 . there hasn't been a ton of movement on the board yet .

title: An Ivy League All-American? The next Theo Epstein? Why an ace chose Yale over the SEC
content: OHman was a freshman navigating his first collegiate baseball season . the 6-foot right-hander barely pitched in high school . he admits he considered leaving the Ivy League for a power 4 school, but who would blame him .

title: How the top QB signings will fit in 2026
content: the top 2026 recruits at each position could fit at their new schools . the perfect harmony between skill and scheme can lead to production and wins on the field . this is the most high-profile prospect Houston has signed in the modern era .

title: Preview for the 2026 PLL, WLL Championship Series: Key players, schedule, predictions
content: the 2026 PLL and WLL Championship Series runs from Feb. 27 to March 8 . the event uses the Sixes format, which will be used when lacrosse returns to the Olympics in 2028 . it has key differences from outdoor "field" lacross and indoor "box" la crosse .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: Who wins People's Puskás Award for world's best amateur goal of the year?
content: the people's Puskás Award is dedicated to singling out the most beautiful goal scored by professional players . the award has given a platform to the very best goals scored at the grassroots and junior levels of the game .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: 45% drop in Indians at US universities over visa uncertainty, high cost
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More
